item.title: Bootstrapping a debian rootfs for use with chroots/containers
item.author: hello@forevergenin.com (Premkumar Subramanian)
item.description: The aim this time is to setup a base rootfs for Ubuntu/Debian distro which can be used for setting up a chroot jail or to create a docker container base image. This blog is based on a earlier blog which I have written but forgot to publish around June, 2012. The below mentioned steps are validated on Fedora 25 Worstation installation. For setting up a debian based rootfs we need a tool called debootstrap.
